Fun.

This game is a very smooth progressing puzzle solver. You don't have to worry much about getting stumped, but that doesn't mean it is easy. It is very engaging and not boring in the slightest. By the time you reach the last part of the game you are putting everything you have previously learned to the test. Definitely a game that is quick to play, but deserves many playthroughs. Each playthough I seem to learn something new that I didn't notice in the last playthrough.
Bon jeu mais physique peu rÃ©aliste.

ĞÑ‡ĞµĞ½ÑŒ Ğ ĞµĞºĞ¾Ğ¼ĞµĞ½Ğ´ÑƒÑ!!!! ĞšÑ€ÑƒÑ‚Ğ°Ñ Ğ³Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ¾Ğ¼ĞºĞ°  Ğ·Ğ°Ñ‚ÑĞ³Ğ¸Ğ²Ğ¾Ñ‰Ğ¸Ñ Ğ¸ ĞºĞ¾Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ‚ĞºĞ°Ñ Ğ½ĞµĞ¼Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ğ±Ñ‹ Ğ±Ğ¾Ğ»ÑŒÑˆĞµ Ğ·Ğ´ĞµĞ»Ğ°Ğ»Ğ¸ Ğ° Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ³ĞµĞ¼Ğ¿Ğ»ĞµĞ¹ 2-3 Ñ‡Ğ°ÑĞ°

ì¸ìƒê²œì´ë‹¤.

10/10

Portal is one of the best gaming experiences I've ever had.  The puzzles are clever and mind-bending without being unintuitive.  The voice acting is impeccable.  The antagonist is interesting, funny, and menacing.  Within an abandoned scientific facility, a world is very well realized.  Everything about Portal is perfect... and then the ending starts and it gets even better.  I didn't know what I was getting into when I first tried Portal when I bought The Orange Box many years ago, and I was immediately hooked and plowed through the game.  If you haven't played it already, do so.  It's a very fun and memorable experience.
The game thrives with creativity and is a claasic. 9/10

ok

Final Score - 6.6/10

â€¢ Graphics - 7/10
â€¢ Story - 3/10
â€¢ Music - 9/10
â€¢ Replayability - 1/10
â€¢ Price Point - 10/10
â€¢ Difficulty - 6/10
â€¢ Pacing - 10/10


Precise Description

â€¢ Graphics - 6/10
Graphics in this game, given the fact it was released back in 2007, looks great, even today. They fit this game well enough and are plesurable to look at. Considering only the atmosphere of the game, I still think that Portal 1's graphics fit this series much better than Portal 2's.

â€¢ Story - 3/10
From the point of view of casual gamer - there's almost no story in this game. In order to find any, you need to listen carefully to literally every bit of dialogue out there, and be extremely focused while explosing the BTS sections of the game (or rather its environment).

â€¢ Music - 9/10
Is great! Portal's soundtrack is one of my favorites. It really fits the atmosphere and that mysterious feel of this game. Once again I think that Portal 1's music fits the series better than Portal 2's.

â€¢ Replayability - 1/10
No, the game is not replayable. Of course, you can still do that, but literally nothing will change. The core story and campaign of the same always remain the game. Fortunately, Portal has a lot of mods out there in the internet and maps made by community. So you can still expand your gameplay if you want.

â€¢ Price Point - 10/10
Nothing to add. It's just worth every cent.

â€¢ Difficulty - 6/10
For most players, the game can be difficult during the first run. The good thing is the level of difficulty is going up during the entire game with a decent speed. There's no such things as a sudden change from very easy puzzles to extremely hard ones.

â€¢ Pacing - 10/10
Everything there is alright. The progression of gameplay is decent and doesn't take forever to get interesting.


Summary

â€¢ Portal is just a great game. Every player who enjoyes solving puzzles will fall in love with it. The same thing happened with me. That's why I currently spent in Portal (1, 2 and all community mods and maps) over 400 hours. I really do recommend this game and if you still haven't played it - just do it. Trust me, it is worth it.

GÃ¼zel

This is the best game I've ever played, It is a little creepy in the atmosphere at times but, it never get's scary. It is a 3 hour campaign and has more additional content, such as advanced challenges and commentary mode. It makes you feel like it was all worth it at the end and the puzzles are the perfect mix of challenging and walk in the park. I can't imagine how someone would dislike this game!
